Twelve hours later....

Celeron was through trying to repair his hopeless computer, he sweeped the small parts into the garbage shoot, which was clogged.

The captain had gone to his quarters a few hours earlier and was recharging.

Celeron looked through the security camera at the prison cell block.  The Warden had been standing in front of Fumeral's cell guarding for hours.  Fumeral lay as he had been when he was thrown into the cell.  The Warden hoped that Fumeral wouldn't wake up, period.

Celeron decided to go for a walk, he wandered out the back of the bridge into the unexplored sections of the back of this deck.  The captain had indicated that some crew members may still be alive in this area.

There was still no light, so Celeron used his spotlight he had found earlier when looking for tools to fix his computer.  This area looked untouched by Fumeral's Rampage.

After a few minutes, he came to some quarters that had light coming from the supposedly airtight doors.  They easily slid open and he cautiously stepped in.  

The room was well lit with power from emergency batteries.  A CR chamber occupied the left half of the room.  As he had suspected, there was still some people alive here.  He read some papers on a desk, that was against the back wall.  The papers indicated that this crewmen was the navigational officer 4th in command.  He attempted to contact the captain, but the lack of power thwarted his attempts.

He decided that no harm could come of letting this fellow wake up, and he prepared to operate the delicate machinery...
